meanings.definition: The state or condition of being imminent.
meanings.sent1: The imminency of the storm made everyone seek shelter.
meanings.sent2: The imminency of the deadline motivated him to work faster.
meanings.sent3: The imminency of the cake baking in the oven filled the house with a delicious aroma.
meanings.sent4: The imminency of the volcano's eruption sent tremors through the town.
meanings.sent5: The imminency of the train's arrival was signaled by the distant sound of its horn.

meanings.definition: The quality of being about to happen.
meanings.sent1: The imminency of the concert excited the fans waiting outside the venue.
meanings.sent2: The imminency of the new year brought a sense of anticipation to the crowd.
meanings.sent3: The imminency of the surprise party was hard to keep a secret.
meanings.sent4: The imminency of the sunrise painted the sky with hues of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The imminency of the final exam made students study late into the night.
